standards: 1.1.1 Naming numbers up to 100
objectives: Students are able to name numbers from 1 to 100 orally and correctly.
activities: Singing number songs 1–100
Game 'Call the Number' using number cards
Naming numbers in ascending and descending order
assessment: Observation while students name the numbers

standards: 1.1.2 Writing numbers in numerals up to 100
objectives: Students are able to write numbers from 1 to 100 in numeral form correctly.
activities: Copying numbers from the chart into exercise books
Filling in the blanks on a number line
Writing numbers activity on small whiteboards
assessment: Checking the accuracy of digit forms

standards: 1.2.1 Counting objects in groups up to 100
objectives: Students are able to count actual objects or pictures in groups up to 100 accurately.
activities: Counting marbles, ice cream sticks, or beans
Counting animal pictures on cards
Group game: 'Count and Report'
assessment: Recording the number of objects in worksheets
aids: Concrete objects (marbles, beads, ice cream sticks)

standards: 1.2.2 Counting in ascending and descending order within 100
objectives: Students are able to count in ascending (1–100) and descending (100–1) order fluently.
activities: Counting steps while walking in the corridor
Using a large number line on the floor
Game 'Number Rocket' (counting down before 'launch')
assessment: Teacher's notes on fluency and confidence

standards: 1.3.1 Recognizing place values of tens and ones for numbers up to 100
objectives: Students are able to identify the place values of tens and ones in two-digit numbers.
activities: Using an abacus or base-10 blocks
Activity 'Separate Tens and Ones' with number cards
Building numbers using place value cards
assessment: Oral Q&A: 'How many tens? How many ones?'

standards: 1.3.2 Stating the digit value of two-digit numbers
objectives: Students are able to state the digit value (e.g., in 45, the digit 4 is worth 40 and 5 is worth 5).
activities: Using digit value cards (40 and 5 for number 45)
Matching numbers with digit value cards
Game 'Find My Value' in pairs

standards: 1.4.1 Adding two numbers within 18
objectives: Students are able to solve addition number sentences up to 18 using concrete objects.
activities: Adding marbles in two containers
Using picture cards to build addition sentences
Game 'Quick Addition' with number cards

standards: 1.4.2 Solving daily problems involving addition up to 18
objectives: Students are able to solve simple daily situations using addition operations up to 18.
activities: Short role-play: 'I have 5 apples, I get 3 more'
Using illustrated story cards
Building number sentences from real situations

standards: 1.5.1 Subtracting two numbers within 18
objectives: Students are able to solve subtraction number sentences up to 18 using concrete objects.
activities: Taking marbles from a container and counting the remainder
Using picture cards to build subtraction sentences
Game 'Subtract & Win' in pairs

standards: 1.5.2 Solving daily problems involving subtraction up to 18
objectives: Students are able to solve simple daily situations using subtraction operations up to 18.
activities: Role-play: 'I have 10 candies, I eat 4'
Using illustrated daily situation cards
Building number sentences from personal experiences

standards: 1.6.1 Stating addition basic facts up to 18 quickly
objectives: Students are able to state addition facts (e.g., 7 + 5 = 12) spontaneously.
activities: 1-minute addition facts quiz
Card game 'Quick Match'
Rhythmic addition facts singing
assessment: Record of time taken to answer 10 questions

standards: 1.6.2 Stating subtraction basic facts up to 18 quickly
objectives: Students are able to state subtraction facts (e.g., 12 – 5 = 7) spontaneously.
activities: Game 'Flash Subtraction' in groups
Using a rotating subtraction facts wheel
Pair practice with question cards
assessment: Checklist for mastery of basic facts

standards: 2.1.1 Recognizing the concept of a half (½) through folding and equal parts
objectives: Students are able to recognize and show a half of an object or shape divided equally.
activities: Folding paper into two equal parts
Coloring half of a circle or square
Dividing a plastic apple into two equal parts

standards: 2.1.2 Recognizing the concept of a quarter (¼) through folding and equal parts
objectives: Students are able to recognize and show a quarter of an object or shape divided into four equal parts.
activities: Folding paper into four equal parts
Dividing a toy pizza into 4 slices
Coloring one of the four parts of a shape
assessment: Oral Q&A: 'Which one is a quarter?'

standards: 3.1.1 Recognizing Malaysian coins and banknotes up to RM10
objectives: Students are able to identify and name coins (5 cents to RM1) and banknotes (RM1 to RM10).
activities: Exhibition 'My Money' with real examples or replicas
Game 'Find the Money' in a mystery box
Arranging money according to ascending value

standards: 3.1.2 Stating the value of money up to RM10
objectives: Students are able to state the value of each coin and banknote correctly.
activities: Matching money with value cards (e.g., RM5 ↔ 'five ringgit' card)
Shop game: 'How much is this?'
Rhythmic money value singing
aids: Value word cards (five cents, two ringgit, etc.)

standards: 4.1.1 Recognizing times of the day (morning, afternoon, evening, night)
objectives: Students are able to relate daily activities with time (morning, evening, night).
activities: Arranging activity cards in chronological order (waking up, sleeping)
Drawing activities at specific times
Discussion: 'What do you do in the evening?'
assessment: Worksheets for arranging activities by time
kategori: Recognizing Daily Time and Analog Clocks

standards: 4.1.2 Reading time on an analog clock (o'clock and half past)
objectives: Students are able to read and state o'clock and half past on an analog clock face.
activities: Using a large analog clock to show time
Game 'Show the Time' in pairs
Drawing clock hands on an empty clock face
assessment: Oral test: 'What time is it now?'
kategori: Recognizing Daily Time and Analog Clocks

standards: 5.1.1 Comparing the length of two objects using non-standard units
objectives: Students are able to compare and state which object is longer or shorter using hand spans, pencils, or ice cream sticks.
activities: Measuring a table using hand spans
Comparing string lengths using paper clips
Activity 'Who is Longer?' in groups

standards: 5.1.2 Comparing weight and volume of liquid using non-standard units
objectives: Students are able to compare weight (heavier/lighter) and liquid volume (more/less) using daily tools.
activities: Weighing a bag of sugar vs a bag of cotton by hand
Pouring water into different sized containers, comparing volume
Game 'Guess the Weight' with mystery bags
aids: Bags containing objects of different weights
Transparent water containers of various sizes

standards: 6.1.1 Recognizing and naming 2D shapes: square, triangle, circle
objectives: Students are able to identify and name two-dimensional shapes in the environment.
activities: Finding 2D shapes in the classroom
Building shapes using ice cream sticks and playdough
Game 'Guess the Shape' with picture cards

standards: 6.1.2 Recognizing and naming 3D shapes: cube, cuboid, sphere
objectives: Students are able to identify and name three-dimensional shapes in daily life.
activities: Collecting 3D objects from home (boxes, balls, milk tins)
Building towers using boxes (cuboids) and tins (spheres/toroids)
Game 'Catch the Shape' – teacher names it, student shows it

standards: 7.1.1 Collecting data through observation and simple surveys
objectives: Students are able to collect data on peers' interests (e.g., favorite color) through oral surveys.
activities: Asking friends: 'What is your favorite color?'
Collecting data using color cards
Recording answers in a simple table

standards: 7.1.2 Organizing data using objects or pictures
objectives: Students are able to organize collected data in the form of an object chart or picture chart.
activities: Arranging shoes by color on the floor
Sticking fruit pictures by type on a notice board
Building a picture chart 'Class Pets'
assessment: Assessment of the picture chart results
aids: Pictures of shoes or actual objects
